title: Huawei MediaPad M5 Lite with stylus 4 GB RAM 64 GB ROM 10.1 inch with Wi-Fi+4G Tablet (Space Grey)

product_specification.Processor Type: HiSilicon Kirin 659 Octa Core (4 x A53 at 2.4 GHz + 4 x A53 at 1.7 GHz)
product_specification.Additional Features: Enhanced Eye-Comfort Mode For Children, Processor: HiSilicon Kirin 659 Octa Core (4 x A53 at 2.4 GHz + 4 x A53 at 1.7 GHz), EMUI 8.0 OS (Based on Android 8.0), 8 MP Primary Camera | 8 MP Front, Voice Call (Single Sim, LTE)
product_specification.Sales Package: Tablet, Travel Adapter (9 V/2 A), USB Type C Cable, SIM Eject Pin, Active Pen Stylus, Warranty Card, Quick Start Guide
product_specification.Sensors: Gravity Sensor, Ambient Light Sensor, Distance Sensor, Fingerprint Sensor, Hall Sensor, Compass
product_specification.Other Camera Features: Auto Focus Rear and Fixed Focus Front Camera
product_specification.Other Connectivity Features: Bluetooth Support, 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Dual Band Wireless Connectivity
product_specification.Other Display Features: Full HD LED Backlit Multi Touch IPS Display with Huawei ClariVu Technology (Supports M-Pen Lite Stylus)
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year on Tablet, 6 Months on Accessories

product_description.1080p Display: The 25.65 cm (10.1) 1080p display of this HUAWEI MediaPad M5 lite offers stunning visuals while you're watching videos, playing games, and working on creative projects. The display also offers improved brightness and clarity, thanks to its HUAWEI ClariVu technology.
product_description.Speakers with Fine-tuned Audio: HUAWEI, in collaboration with Harman Kardon, offers a quad-speaker system in this tablet to deliver fine-tuned, high-quality audio. This system offers highly optimized concert hall audio effects, featuring high bass and low distortion.
product_description.3D Surround Sound: The HUAWEI Histen 5.0 stereo audio of this tablet offers multi-layered soundscapes for a 3D surround sound experience.
product_description.Get Inspired and Be Efficient: This tablet comes with the HUAWEI M-Pen lite Stylus that has advanced 2048-layer pressure sensitivity to let you draw, sketch, and create visual wonders. You can also write memos and take notes easily with this stylus.
product_description.Long Battery Life: You can fully charge this tablet in less than 2.9 hours, thanks to its fast-charging facility. Furthermore, the 7500 mAh battery offers long hours of uninterrupted performance.
product_description.Eye-comfort Mode for Children: This mode ensures that your child’s eyes are protected while using this device. It effectively lowers harmful blue light and also sends smart reminders when the display is too close to the kid’s face while using it.
product_description.Elegant Device: A metal unibody build, along with the 2.5D curved glass edge, offers style and comfort. Also, it is a light and slim device that you can use for long hours as well as easily carry it along.

review:
Pro :
1. Super IPS Display, display quality is awesome..
2. Amazing Sound, even best of Tablets Misses that quality and quad speaker sound, for Media purpose its an awesome product..
3. Active stylus is good but lags a bit..
4. Battery is decent, Not so good nor Bad.
5. 4G sim working is a good addition + SD card support, as 32/64 GB variant are not enough for storage. so good it has SD Support up to 256 GB

Cons :
1. Very old Android 8.0.0
2. Even EMUI is 8.0 too old where has new devices are ready with EMUI 10...
3. Stylus Pen is good addition but lags a bit and has no dedicated In built software for it. Need to install 3rd party apps. But overall a good feature.
4. "NO DESKTOP MODE", I contacted the Huawei and asked how to enable Desktop Mode, They Replied for Indian Version Tablet is not compatible for desktop mode, But International version does, I don't know if an Update could enable it.
5. Fingerprint button is as per Landscape Mode, so while taking Noted we tend to press it by mistake.
6. NO Face Unlock as of Now.
7. No official Keyboard Available.

Ordered this one for my kids, it comes with a pen. Which is very nice and Kids are enjoying it. sone pre-installed apps for kids where to they can do some painting and stuff using pen. I have setup this one with Google kids account which let you control he tab from your phone. Screen clarity is very good, Sound quality is fabulous with the harman kardon speakers and it will give 10 out of 10 for the speaker quality, camera could have been more better. Even though it says fast charging, the charging takes hours to reach 100%. Still I would recommend you too buy this one and with this configuration this would the best price option.

Although you will not get any software update from Google but security patch is updated regularly with a lag of few months. Currently its running on August 2020 patch. Android is 8.0. I am reviewing it after more than one month of use. I have listed the pros and cons bellow
Pros:
1. The sound output from 4 stereo speaker is just amazing, it can even beat a budget Bluetooth speaker.
2. Battery life is excellent as it has a 7500 mAh battery
3. Built quality is also impressive as it has full aluminum body
4. Screen brightness is very good and auto brightness works good. overall screen quality is good
5. For reading and media consumption it is perfect
6. I use it with M pen lite and it works perfectly
7. As I don't play games, can't say about heavy games but for normal uses, light video and audio editing it works perfect.

Cons:
1. The volume and lock key are not perfectly fitted so it feels like loose.(may be for my device only)
2. Does not support volte. (only 4G internet can be connected, 3G calling is available)
3. 3.5mm jack is at left bottom corner, it should be at middle or some what above that because with my cover, I could not use earphone so I have to modify the cover (may not be a problem for other covers)
5. It is very slippery and heavy so cover is needed otherwise it may fall.
6. M pen lite should be included along with it in same price.

More over it is a great product in the price range.

I got this tab on offer for 18400/- , Packing and delivery is good.

Screen have some uniformity issues, one side it is very bright other side have some screen burning issues. Flipkart will not accept these things as an issue while selling, but in exchange they will say screen has burning issues and can't be taken it.

Also screen quality is not upto mark as Full HD

Don't expect much from camera, It is like a 2MP

Seems sound is not effective from down speakers

Speaker grill at bottom side is good, but upside is very sharp and can scratch fingers

Suggestions:

Speakers are louder, but can be provided side speakers bit more louder instead of Harman brand for a tablet

Also instead of stylus, could have provided good display and slightly better camera.

Then this would be the best tablet in this segment

Pros:
1) Great sound you can feel the pump as 4 speakers blast (in landscape mode) as well as while gaming you don't cover them so its a good experience
2) 1080p display
3) Stylus which works decent
4) Upgrade storage by SD card (I got 128gb card and now its smooth)

Cons:
1) 1080p is fine but software like VLC and MX Player run jaggy if x265 format is played as the processor is old as well
2) Stylus lags and has no buttons on it like other Huawei Active Pens which is handy as a controller
3) Android 8 has glitchy support with some apps like Spotify which was constantly sticking by switching from portrait to landscape mode on its own. Software updates are required to fix these issues.

Have paired it with a logitech k480 keyboard and 128gb samsung evo class 3 sd card. If you are looking for lenovo d330 alternative, this feels premium but the lack of software update might be concerning if things start to break drastically after Android R becomes stable amd support for Oreo would be reduced.

No Desktop mode so that's a buzzkill.

Pros:
1. Battery: The battery life is really good. Charging 7000mAh completely takes around 4-6hours based on the quick charger. Once it is charged, you can easily expect it for 1day for massive usage ( I repeat massive).

2. Display: watching Netflix, prime, hotstar, youtube.... are really good. The display is good.

3. Huawei Pen: That's a good add on. You can right notes easily or do basic surfing with the pen, when you're in a Starbucks. You get little attention from people around you for using it.

4. 4G Connectivity: This is also a good feature, you can have dedicated sim and use data through it instead of using hotspot from your mobile.

5. Design: initially it looks odd to have landscape orientation but believe me you will get habituated to it and the tab itself is so slim and light weight for its construction.

6. Fingerprint Scanner: it's very fast and quick.

7. Speakers: It has total four speakers and they are really loud and clear. Moreover the speakers are made by Harman Kardon, they are once of the leading companies in Automotive division. They sound similar to google home mini.

Cons:
1. Cameras: both the cameras are good for Skype and video calls but don't expect any advance features you see in smartphones. It's an average camera.

2. Charging Time: Though it supports 18w fast charging, it takes 4hours minimum to charge it's huge battery.

It is excellent tab it supports all apps including google apps also. Camera also very Good.Sound also excellent. Great battery . Very slim tab. We can see in this tab Watts app,calling,zoom meeting, all futures are excellent.

Here is my DETAILED and GENUINE REVIEW of Huwaei Mediapad M5 Lite after using it for nearly 10 days.
*DISPLAY: Display is really awesome and too bright. Watching web series and any YouTube videos at 1080p is really enjoyable. The auto-brightness works well and also touch response is great. Under 20k price ,overall display is outstanding(Multimedia and entertainment king).
*BUILD and DESIGN:Full metallic body and looks premium. But remember it's slippery, so better to use cover.
*PERFORMANCE:Performance is Ok, no lag issue found till now. But remember Kirin 659 is not for heavy gaming. I am using this tab for my study purpose and I am fully satisfied . Split screen works fine and multi tasking is also great in 4GB RAM option. RAM management is descent.
*SPEAKER :Wow, the speakers are powered by Harmon Kardon and these sounds really great. Music listening in this tablet is fun and enjoyable.
*M-PEN: M-pen stylus works fine. Sometimes it lags but what Huwaei provides under this price no other tablet provides any stylus support. Note taking is OK.
*CAMERA: Camera is average and also tablets are not for photography purpose. Online classes, video calling, documents scanning is overall great in this tablet.
*BATTERY : Outstanding and nice battery backup . 7500mAh battery performs great.
*SOFTWARE And ANDROID 8: This is the only downside of this tablet if you consider its old Android 8 version. But for me, there is no problem with Android 8 and google services works fine . But it will be better if Huwaei upgrade its Android version to Android 9 pie or Android 10 in future.
NOTE: This tablet is highly recommended for students and note taking is overall great. This tablet is not for gaming purpose.
So, under the pricing of 20K , it is the best option available in market.

That’s all in an affordable budget if you compare to other Tablets ✌️✌️

The only negative point is Android update not being available (For its own reasons) due to which apps like YouTube at times couldn’t display videos etc.

Barring that, it’s a good bargain at this price.

4. Kids Zone is a Plus feature here.
5. Quick Charge, yes nice feature in this price range.
6. 7500mAh Enough Battery for a Tablet.
7. Stylus is good.
8. Metallic Body and sleek body no bulky.
9 Camera is good.

Cons-
1. The OS version is old but hope for a new update or upgrade.
2. Style Lags- It is fine, not impressive but in this price range they offering Stylus so we should Hats Off :)
3. No Keyboard Option.
4. Fingerprint sensor should be aligned with Tablet Lock key, sometimes it's you know,... SEARCHING UNLOCK SENSOR especially when we are using Tablet Horizontally.

I had an apple ipad 3 for quite some time. My biggest grouse with Apple was that they stop support for devices after some years for newer generation of iOS. Although it happens on android too, but, Android devices are not that expensive.

Coming from an apple ipad 3, this tablet seemed way faster.

Screen: Screen is decent but not smooth. I use a OnePlus 7T (on 90Hz), and I feel the transitions leave a trail which irritates sometimes. Otherwise, the tab has a bright screen which is sufficient for most tasks on a daily basis. Glare is quite evident and some improvement could be done by Huawei in this department.


Active Pen: Works beautifully. Blocks unwanted touches to a large degree and works with low latency. Feels quite premium.

Camera: not very good but you won't buy a tablet for its camera. If a camera is your priority, look elsewhere.

Battery: Superb. Lasts over a day of excessive usage.

Performance: Good for a tablet in this price range. Did not have trouble handling multitasking. Ram seems to be enough at 4GB. Processor could be better.

Storage: came with 64 GB, and is expandable. Decent speeds.

Wifi/BT: good

Pricing: Got it for under 18k in BBD sale. Seems to be rightly priced with an active pen. Huawei could include a cover for protection.

Should you buy it?
Blame Steve jobs for making us want tablets. However, if your needs are to watch movies/series on a bigger screen vs mobile, do document editing, casual art etc, this is a good device for you. If you want a performance oriented tab, look at Samsung S6/S7.

Overall good device
1. Note-taking :- I am writing this review using M-pen(provided in package) and the text recognition is also fair enough. Use Inkredible app for note taking, which works flawlessly. It' s built in app, nebo, which is also good but has unnecessary restrictions while drawing something directly over page. Squid doesn't work well. Bamboo paper works average on it.
2. Video playback and Sound :- Gorgeous display with good colours. Plays 1080P, 60 FPS like a Charm. supports max, upto 1440p . Lacks 4k playback. Audio quality is more than enough for you unless you are fond of music with various low and high beats. Low beats are mostly suppressed by speaker, so not so pleasing at that time.
3. Smoothness of UI:- Smooth for medium usage. Lags for a second or two while switching between tabs in chrome. Other things work very well like navigating across various apps, multi-window feature.
4. Gaming :- Stuck at Iow graphics in COD mobile. PUBG-minor frame drops at balanced graphics & medium frame rate. Asphault-8 > Stuck at High graphics and playable frame rates, graphics are excellent. Asphault 9 works a bit smoother on default visual settings and plays smoothly most of the time.

I bought 3/32 version in 14,399/- after using SBI card discount. If you don't have use for too much space, 3/32 will work great as you get around 21GB free space and around 2.3GB free memory.

Others have already mentioned most of the features but a couple of them which went unnoticed are as follows:

1. It has a WiFi bridge option. It means that you can connect to one wifi and share that same wifi as hotspot simultaneously. It's really handy feature to extend wifi range.

2. It can also charge your phone as act as powerbank using appropriate cable (didn't try but there is one option when you connect the usb cable)

3. Huawei HiSuite is the perfect software to manage tab - backup/restore and OS management; e.g. recovery. I had to use VPN to download it. Maybe the site is blocked. Benefits of HiSuite
a - It provides a feature to allow to connect HiSuite enabling USB debugging and this has vast impacts. It makes your tab ultra safe. Even if someone gets access to your tab, OS can't be flashed if USB debugging is enabled which will render it useless for thieves too!
b - You can backup almost everything (yeah no need to backup to Google just keep it locally) - including system settings, apps WITH DATA. No need to root to make backups. Even if you have to root you can make backup and restore everything.

4. The charger supports 10W, 18W and 40W fast charging! I don't know how much the tab supports but this charger can be used with perhaps the newest fast charging phones.

5. Battery is super awesome and the OS is very much optimized. I got approx 20 hrs screen time with mostly PDF (Xodo software) and Onenote - stylus. I had used wifi for around 2-3 hrs in totality, SIM for around 10 minutes only (just to test) and was on power saving mode for the whole time. Xodo has this feature to keep screen on which I enabled.

This is the best OS I've come across. I rooted my old phone because it lacked some basic features but this tablet OS is bundled with all of them with some additional features as well - navigation gestures (fingerprint and on screen with that circle kind of icon), rotation to 90, 180, 270 degrees, Speed meter on status bar, Wifi bridge, Power On/Off schedule, Option to backup apps with data and the best which I didn't even think of - Using HiSuite without enabling USB debugging.

Those who are not happy with Android 8, guys new android versions rarely have something for the end customers. Mostly those are for developers who get new API and developer tools. So, except a few features like Desktop mode, those are more or less useless.

Only con is that the MPen is not perfect. It sometimes misses taps which is acceptable. After 4-5 days, now MPen seems to write better. Maybe I took time to get used to it. The taps are still not flawless and small parts of the strokes are missed too (rare, though) but I watched on a video that even apple pencil tend to behave like that.

For those who need this to study, this is absolutely bliss in Android and in this price segment. Getting it for 14,400/- (on BBD) is in my opinion, a very good price considering 4/64 GB phones with around 6inch screen phones are available for around 9K. Still, this tab can very well be considered worth 18K. Can't say above that is just or not.

Pros:
1. 2.5D display. It’s gives a feel very premium feel.
2. Aluminium back.
3. Quad speakers. 4 speakers that gives a 3D effect to your audio. They aren’t very loud but definitely loud enough to be heard throughout the room.
4. M-pen lite. I’ve always felt stylus wasn’t needed for a media device but this changed my perspective. It’s super smooth. Lags a tad when you take notes but it’s not frustrating or deal breaker.
5. Battery backup. Battery standby on battery saver mode is great. Can easily use it for 2 days on moderate usage. But even otherwise the battery backup is appreciable.
6. Support application. This is a unique application which provides all information regarding your tablet. It also provides the cost of components and services charges for replacement. I found this really helpful.

Cons:
1. No update. This is the single largest con of this device. It’s confirmed by one of Huawei’s developer on an official forum that there is no plans to update this device. We MAY eventually get HarmonyOS update but that’s doubtful too.
2. No dark mode. The screen is super bright and I wish there was a dark mode. But since there’s no Android 10 hence no dark mode.
3. No desktop mode. Again this is a limitation of the operating system. No android 10 hence no desktop mode.
4. Extremely glossy screen. It’s such a throw off to be honest. I’m also unable to find an anti-gloss/ matte screen guard to counter this.

Compromises:
1. The screen is of standard quality that you get in this price range. They are just decent. No AMOLED hence the contrast isn’t great and the screen isn’t saturated. Pixel density is also average. Since it’s an IPS LCD screen the screen feels too bright/white. Considering the price tag this is impossible to provide.
2. M-pen lite is good but it doesn’t have a button to perform any task. The screen recognises the stylus when it’s in close proximity but due to a lack of button no actions can be performed. Having a button would likely require it to have Bluetooth. This would bring in the additional burden of requiring a charging infrastructure for the stylus.
3. Could have had slightly better processor. Honor tab T5 has Kirin 710 while this has Kirin 659. Having the same processor here would have been a great addition.
4. No 4G VoLTE. You can use 4G internet without problem. You can also make calls on JioCall app via internet if you are a Jio user but otherwise you are left hanging. I personally never use call features on a tablet. I’m not sure if VoLTE is a software or a hardware feature enhancement over 4G but either way you are doomed if this is a necessity for your lifestyle.
5. Slightly on the heavy side. This is also a standard weight for tablets of 10 inch. It feels heavy and really uncomfortable while using the tablet lying on your back.

Verdict:
Having used it for sometime now I’d recommend this for media consumption. Be it watching video, reading or listening to audio. Decent features along with stylus and aggressive pricing makes this a must buy. If you are confused between this and Samsung A7 I’d recommend Huawei mediapad M5 lite as this hands down beats it in almost every segment. The only exception being receiving further updates. This is one of the better tablets that you can buy at this price range. With discounts and bank offers you will easily be able to buy this tablet at much lower than it’s quoted price. Overall I’m mightily impressed with this tablet and hope you will too.

Best for students

- Display quality : Good Display Panel, Good indoor brightness, Eye safe filter is good and does its job. No strain.
- Battery Life : Best battery Life among Tablets, 7500mah battery also works great with this huge display.
Normal usage gives you around 2 day battery life. Heavy usage with games and Video calls/Calling can give you 1 full day life.
- Gaming: Not for high end gaming, Like PUBG and COD it will struggle if you force to put the game on medium settings. And can easily play at low settings.

You can play low tier games like subways surfers, temple run, and other low gpu demanding games flawlessly.
- Ram Mngt. It will give you about 2.5GB ram for your apps which id enough to run apps smoothly and a good multitasking.
- Pen support: pen is great at touch response, and also palm rejection while writing is perfect. (Recommended: use inbuilt apps for notes and writing).
Pen battery last for about 6 month and use AAAA cell which will cost about Rs250.
-100% charged battery:Video Streaming on amazom prime video_ 2. 5 hours movies leaves tablet with about 82%
-100% charged battery : YouTube stream for 2 hour leaves about 85%
-Security : Fingerprint work super fast and looks secure.
App Lock is available.
Lockscreen is simple/sleek looks grt.
-Screen Recording: Available with external audio recording.

Cons noted:
System update isn't available frequently.
Currently its running on android 8.0 amd till now there's no update. Not sure it'll receive Android 9 update in future.
Default home Launcher is not that good for advanced user.
Chrome browser takes up battery.
Recommended use any other Internet Browser. Like Firefox, Samsung Internet or Duck duck go. Low end CPU for gaming.


Recommended For people:
For Entertainment: Back to back movies playback without charging.
Music: great sound quality. Stereo sound is good.
For low gamers: It can run other gmes smoothly like GTA Vice city and Sanandreas, Talking tom, Runners and other low end game.
Work from home people:
Its good for online task and for documents editing, note making, easy writing.
Its perfect at this price for Multimedia Playback. Battery life is great for non stop video and music play for hours long.

Not recommended for:
Photographer : camera quality is fine as per tablet cemera and at this price but not that good for high professional photos.

High Gamers: if you want it for PUBG or COD and other high end games than forget about it as its CPU/GPU is not good for playing games at even medium settings. PUBG is only playable at low graphics and about 15-20fps.

This tablet uses only 1 antenna internally which it uses for both bluetooth and wireless. So if you want to do some heavy wifi internet downloading while using bluetooth, then forget this tablet. I tried it. It works good only if one is being used. Either wireless, then bluetooth must be off. If you use bluetooth then wireless must be off.
If both are on, then you will get such slow speeds of wifi that it will be a real headache for you. There is no solution for this problem as this is a hardware issue.

pros.7500 mAh Battery: This tablet features a massive 7500 mAh battery which lasts really long and gives an uninterrupted experience.
pros.25.65 cm (10.1) 1080p display: The 25.65 cm (10.1) 1080p display of this tablet offers stunning and beautiful visuals which gives amazing viewing experience.
pros.Performance: The HiSilicon Kirin 659 Octa Core processor is good and gives a seamless performance for normal tasks.
pros.Huawei Pen: This tablet comes with a stylus pen which helps in taking notes effortlessly.

cons.Camera: The 8MP front camera and 8MP rear camera are just not upto the mark and are very poor in quality.
cons.Charging: Although this tablet comes with a 18W fast charger but takes around 4 hours of minimum time to fully charge its huge battery.

summary.verdict: The Huawei MediaPad M5 Lite with stylus is an excellent choice in this price segment and comes with some amazing features.
summary.Additional Information: Good for study purpose, M pen, Supports PubG.
